channel.title: Projects on My Website
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on My Website

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Modeling Guidelines and Rubric 0. (5 pts) Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph. What are they measuring? How many observations? My dataset contains data regarding global land temperature change of major cities in the world collected from 1849 to 2013. The variables of this dataset are date (dt), average temperature, average temperature uncertainty, city, country, latitude, and longitude.

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Esther Kim (ek8435) Data Wrangling and Data Exploration Rubric Prerequisite: Finding appropriate data from at least two sources per the instructions above: Failure to do this will result in a 0! You will submit a .Rmd file and a knitted document (pdf). 0. Introduction (4 pts) Write a narrative introductory paragraph or two describing the datasets you have chosen, the variables they contain, how they were acquired, and why they are interesting to you.
